descriptionProfile: Official Instagram of the photography website Feature Shoot. Tag #myfeatureshoot to be considered.
Official Instagram of the photography website Feature Shoot. Tag

posts.description: 'Misty morning in Venice' by photographer Goran Pavletic (@alter_ego_ran). Submit images for consideration by tagging them #myfeatureshoot. // #landscapephotography #landscapelovers #Venice #contemporaryphotography #landscapecaptures #goldenhour #magichour #minimallandscape #mindtheminimal #minimalist #ig_minimalistic

‘Twilight over Vang Vieng with Venus and Paper Lanterns’ by photographer Deborah Barak (@debbarak) has been selected as a winning image for The Print Swap. @theprintswap is designed to connect photographers around the world. Winners, like Barak, will have their photographs made into fine art prints by @skink_ink in #Brooklyn. From there, every winning print will be mailed out at random to the winning artist. Every winner gives a print and receives a print in return. Find all the details at www.theprintswap.com. // #VangVieng #Laos #photocontest #magichour #landcapecaptures #landscapelovers #longexpo #longexposure

Photographer Ruman Hamdani (@theotherrumii) studied engineering in #Delhi, but he longed to go back home to #Srinagar, where he had spent his childhood. He found inspiration in his roots. "I would come back during the semester holidays and carry my camera everywhere," he remembers, "In Delhi, I would rarely use my camera." Of this image, he writes, "While I was walking along the #Jhelum River, this kid came out of his little makeshift house. As I pointed my camera, he ran back in and then came out again and went back again, not letting me take a picture. I lowered my camera and moved ahead. Knowing that he was curious, I quickly turned back and took the picture while he was checking if I had left." Follow along at @theotherrumii for more.

"I've grown to love the old part of #Srinagar, and I often do photo walks there," photographer Ruman Hamdani (@theotherrumii) tells us, "The people, the shrines, the architecture, everything takes you to a different era. As urbanization grows, the city is losing its traditional charm. I feel through my images, I can contribute to preserving our culture." He spotted this textile vendor on #Dal Lake. "His boat carried all kinds of cloth, mostly woolens, as it was winter," Hamdani writes, "As they were rowing ahead, I saw a lady walking along the bank bargaining over stitching charges with the vendor. The boat never stopped, but they seemed to make a deal." // #documentaryphotography #streetphotography #streetphoto #streetportrait #photostreet

"The more I traveled through #Kashmir, the more my desire to share its natural beauty with the world grew," photographer/filmmaker Ruman Hamdani (@theotherrumii) writes of his artistic beginnings, "In the beginning, I would use my father's phone to take pictures and later with a small point and shoot." Of this image, he writes, "The little shepherd boy was  shy and preferred to tend to his sheep. While #Srinagar city is quickly getting modernized, many parts still present village-like scenes." // #documentaryphotography #contemporaryphotography #tinypeopleinbigplaces #landscapelovers #landscapecaptures #captivatingkashmir #indiapictures

Today's takeover is by photographer and filmmaker Ruman Hamdani (@theotherrumii), who grew up in #Srinagar, #India. "I was always drawn to beauty and spending time in nature, something I credit my father for," the artist writes, "We would often go to the various hill stations of #Kashmir. I loved observing these places and the lifestyle of the people who lived there." He spotted this pair fishing on #Nigeen Lake. "The reflections and the symmetry here were pleasing to the eyes," Hamdani remembers The two men were actually both on their phones, while their fishing rods were doing the work." // #contemporaryphotography #landscapephotography #landscapelovers #landscapecaptures #liveoutdoors #tinypeopleinbigplaces #documentaryphotography

This is 'Challenger, Brooklyn,' a moment captured by photographer Torz Dallison (@torzdallison). This image has been chosen to be a part of The Print Swap (@theprintswap), an ongoing submissions-based contest for photographers across the globe. Submit simply by tagging your image #theprintswap. If your photo is selected as a winner, you will be notified, and your work will be printed by the experts at Skink Ink (@skink_ink) in #Brooklyn. Your print will then be mailed to another photographer somewhere in the world, and you will receive a surprise print from another winner. See the ongoing gallery of winners over at @theprintswap. // #photocontest #dodgechallenger #fineartphotography #brooklyn #contemporaryphotography

#1940s street photographer Todd Webb's (@toddwebbarchive) pictures are back in #NYC! Vintage prints, along with newer prints made by John Hill, the executor of the estate of Walker Evans, are now on view at The Curator Gallery (@thecuratorgallery). The exhibition coincides with 'City Seen,' a large Todd Webb retrospective at The Museum of the City of New York (@museumofcityny), where his work was shown more than 70 years ago. Webb took this picture-- 'Near Fulton Fish Market'-- in 1946. // #silvergelatin #toddwebb #streetportrait #oldphoto #streetphotographer #monochrome #blackandwhiteonly #blackandwhitenewyorkcity #blackandwhitephoto #streetphotography #documentaryphotography

"I love the process of trial and error, and then when you get that one amazing shot, all of the frustration becomes worth it," photographer Danielle Goddard (@elle.draddog) writes, "It's a little euphoric, and as long as that feeling lasts, I'll continue to look for new ways to see the world." Her photograph, ‘Febrary,’ will be part of The Print Swap. As a winner of @theprintswap, Goddard’s photograph will be printed by our friends at @skink_ink in #Brooklyn and mailed to another winner somewhere in the world. In exchange, Goddard will receive a surprise print at her doorstep. To be considered for the swap, simply tag your photos #theprintswap. Check out www.theprintswap.com for details. // #photocontest #fineartphotography

“On assignment for National Geographic (@natgeo) in #Yellowstone National Park, I left my Montana motel while it was still dark outside," photojournalist David Guttenfelder (@dguttenfelder) told us recently, "I was driving towards a riverside pasture outside of town with a plan to standing in a field of grazing bison while the sun rose. But when the morning light came, ominous and richly red, I was trapped at a red traffic light behind rows of work commuters in #Bozeman. That morning, for Nat Geo, I’d failed. But the smartphone photo I shot, and posted to my Instagram account while still sitting at the intersection in my truck, remains my most 'liked' photo (with more than 30,000)." // #nationalpark #ontheroadagain #americanroads

'Praying for a Miracle' by Robin Hammond (@hammond_robin) has been named the Second Prize Single in the "People "Category at World Press Photo 2017 (@worldpressphoto). "Hellen Alfred lives with a mental health condition in #Juba, South Sudan. She says she fell ill after the birth of her sixth child," Hammond writes of this photo, "Mental illness in South Sudan is often attributed to witchcraft. This means the mentally ill are frequently ostracized and regarded as a danger to society. Juba has only a handful of qualified psychiatrists and psychologists, but international NGOs are working with the Sudanese authorities to improve conditions for the mentally ill." The work was commissioned by @noorimages for Handicap International. // #wPPh2017

We recently asked 6 photo editors to tell us how they use IG to find talent. Francesca Gennari of Burn Magazine (@burnmagazine), told us, "I use it daily—it’s very important to be always connected. Instagram uses a language that is much more immediate and allows you to understand how a photographer ‘sees’—it often tells you more about a photographer than a photo essay." This image is from the series ‘Sin and Salvation in Baptist Town’ by Matt Eich (@matteich), which Gennari found via IG. Of the work, Eich writes, "For the last 4 years I have been drawn to #Greenwood, #Mississippi like a moth to a flame. I have explored a complex intersection of issues that span race, class, joblessness, opportunity, housing, education and segregation."

Scarlett Hooft Graafland took this photograph on the shores of Belo sur Mer in #Madagascar, using local fishermen and their canoes as her subject. In each canoe, you can see the knees of a fisherman poking out. When traveling to remote and often harsh landscapes, Hooft Graafland gets to know the local community and collaborates with them closely to make her surreal scenes. 'Discovery', the artist's solo exhibition at Flowers Gallery (@flowersgallery) in #London, is on view through today, Saturday, April 29th. All images on view are printed directly from the artist's negatives. // #fineartphotography #contemporaryphotography #belosumer #landscapelovers #analoguevibes #analogphotography #tinypeopleinbigplaces

In 1946, the same year he took this photograph at #6thAvenue in #NYC, the great photographer #ToddWebb wrote the following in his journal: “I am full of things to do, and I have no spare time on my hands. It seems like a very good life. I am broke. But what the hell, you can’t have everything.” Before he found success as a photographer, Webb had been a stockbroker, a gold prospector, and a forest ranger. He wrote stories, though they were never published. He served in the Second World War. Now, his photographs are being show in two exhibitions: 'City Seen' at The Museum of the City of New York (@museumofcityny) and 'Down Any Street' at The Curator Gallery (@thecuratorgallery). Learn more at @toddwebbarchive. // #silvergelatin #streetphoto

Surreal self-portraitist Izumi Miyazaki is one of the 40 female photographers spotlighted in 'Girl on Girl: Art and Photography in the Age of the Female Gaze', a new book by writer/curator Charlotte Jansen (@omfgnoway). In the book, the artist touches on the expectation of women to be "kawaii" (meaning "cute"). She herself often chooses to be "kowai" (meaning "scary") instead. "I have no special message or purpose when I take photos," Miyazaki told @CNN last summer, "I only hope that visitors approach my photography with an open mind -- with as much freedom of thinking as I try to have when I create a picture." Head on over to publisher Lawrence King (@laurencekingpub) to get your copy of 'Girl on Girl.' // #femalegaze #selfportrait

Scarlett Hooft Graafland photographed this 11-year-old boy on the island of #Malekula in #Vanuatu. As with elements in many of the artists photograph, the yellow ship in his arms references the place's history. The ship is a model of HMS Resolution, the preferred ship of 18th century Captain James Cook. "The boy is a descendant of the chief of the tribe that welcomed Captain Cook to the island, two and a half centuries ago, when Cook’s ship laid at anchor at the same spot," Hooft Graafland explains in the image's caption. This photo and others from the artist's many travels are on view at Flowers Gallery (@flowersgallery) in #London through today. // #ScarlettHooftGraafland #fineartphotography #contemporaryphotograph

The late photographer #ToddWebb (@toddwebbarchive) was friends with #WalkerEvans, #GordonParks, #AnselAdams, #LisetteModel, #BereniceAbbott, and #AlfredStieglitz and Georgia O’Keeffe. "They drank together, ate together, traveled together, worked together," curator Bill Shapiro writes, "But while the others became stars, Webb took himself off that path." Shapiro has since gotten to know Webb through his journal entries. “Everybody should know his name," the curator says. 'Down Any Street: Todd Webb’s Photographs of New York 1946-1960' at The Curator Gallery (@thecuratorgallery) is on view now. Shapiro's exhibition coincides with 'City Seen', a large Todd Webb retrospective at The Museum of the City of New York (@museumofcityny).
